result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael H Brajdic was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Attempt Theft-Movable Property-Special Facts [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500 [Modifiers: Repeater], a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).
  • Possession of Cocaine/Coca(2nd+) [Modifiers: Repeater], a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(c).
  • Bail Jumping-Felony [Modifiers: Repeater], a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(b).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Concurrent to any other sentence.  Sentence is to commence immediately.

superMiscConds.notes: Court orders the fines, costs, and restitution in this file shall be paid from all funds received into the defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy, not to exceed 25% of gross during the term of initial confinement. If any fines, costs, and/or restitution remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.  If probation/supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

records.addlTxt:
9:09 a.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty William Lennon.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Lennon - matters are resolved, defendant will plea to counts 2,4,6 & 8 and balance of the counts will be dismissed and read-in.  Statement by DA regarding sentence.  Atty Lennon concurs.  State concurs.  Defendant concurs.

Court goes over plea questionnaire with the defendant.  Court goes over constitutional rights with the defendant - defendant waives these rights.  Court goes over the elements of each offense.  Court instructs defendant of the maximum penalty and as a repeater.  Court instructs defendant regarding deportation.  (If felony) Court instructs regarding felony prohibitions.

Defendant enters a plea of NO CONTEST.  Court finds the plea is made freely, voluntarily, intelligently and understandingly.  Court finds there is a factual basis to support the plea.  Court finds the defendant guilty on counts 2,4,6 & 8 as charged.  Court orders the balance of the counts be dismissed and read-in.  Court orders the judgment of conviction be entered here today.  DA confirms compliance with victim witness rights.  Sentencing statement by DA.  Sentencing statement by Atty Lennon.  No statement by the defendant.

Court sentences the defendant to:

COUNT 2- 1 1/2 years of Initial Confinement and 1 1/2 years of Extended Supervision - concurrent to any other sentence.
COUNT 4- 9 months county jail, concurrent to any other sentence
COUNT 6- 1 1/2 years of Initial Confinement and 1 1/2 years of Extended Supervision - consecutive to any other count in this case and concurrent to any other sentence.
COUNT 8- 2 years of Initial Confinement and 2 years of Extended Supervision - consecutive to any other count in this case and concurrent to any other sentence.

CONDITIONS:

-court costs - Court orders the fines, costs, and restitution in this file shall be paid from all funds received into the defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy, not to exceed 25% of gross during the term of initial confinement. If any fines, costs, and/or restitution remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.  If probation/supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

-restitution - $1000.00 - Court orders the fines, costs, and restitution in this file shall be paid from all funds received into the defendant's prison accounts in accordance with prison policy, not to exceed 25% of gross during the term of initial confinement. If any fines, costs, and/or restitution remain outstanding at the end of the initial confinement portion of this sentence, then the remaining shall be paid as a condition of extended supervision.  If probation/supervision is revoked or discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

-Defendant is to abide by all rules and recommendations of the supervising agent.
-No Contact with the victims - Jerome & Shirley Lenz.
-AODA and any follow-up

Court finds the defendant eligible for the CIP & SAR programs.

Sentence to commence immediately.

Court grants sentence credit from 04/11/2015.

Court adjourned at 9:30 a.m.
Plea/sentencing hearing at 09-14-2015 09:00 am

8:55 a.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney William Lennon present.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Lennon - believes this matter can be resolved and has Fond du lac county cases also and requests a plea & sentencing be scheduled.  No objection by DA to schedule after September 11, 2015.  Court sets for plea & sentencing on September 14, 2015 at 9:00 a.m.

Court adjourned at 8:56 a.m.
of hearing held on April 28, 2015, before Hon Mark T. Slate - Circuit Court Judge, by Jill M. Bartol - Court Reporter
Status hearing at 06-15-2015 08:30 am

9:17 a.m.  No appearance by the defendant.  Attorney William Lennon.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Lennon - has just received Discovery and requests another status hearing.  Court sets for status hearing on June 15, 2015 at 8:30 a.m.

Court adjourned at 9:18 a.m.
By Atty William Lennon
Summary of Restitution - $1,000.00
Status hearing at 05-18-2015 09:00 am

1:08 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty William Lennon.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atty Lennon - will be a preliminary hearing.

Michael Prachel sworn, direct by DA Christenson, is employed as a Deputy Sheriff for Green Lake County Sheriff's Department and was working on 04/11/2015.  Lakeview Road address - Town of Green Lake - Green Lake County - Wisconsin.  Identified the defendant present in court.  Cross exam by Atty Lennon.

Argument by DA Christenson.  Argument by Atty Lennon.

Court finds probable cause to believe that a felony has been committed and probable cause that the felony was committed by the defendant and binds the defendant over for trial.

State files an information with the court.  Attorney Lennon and defendant acknowledge receipt of the information and waives any reading.  Atty Lennon enters a plea of Not Guilty on behalf of the defendant.  Court sets for Status Hearing on May 18, 2015 at 9:00 a.m. 

Court adjourned at 1:21 p.m.
Preliminary hearing at 04-28-2015 01:00 pm

1:33 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court with Atty Barb Privat.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Statement by Atrty Privat - defendant is eligible for representation but will be appointed out.  Atty Privat  confirms receipt of the criminal complaint and waives reading.  Court instructs the defendant of the maximum penalty on each count and as repeater.  Court finds probable cause.  Court notes bond as been set - $5,000.00 cash and condition.  Court instructs defendant regarding his/her right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant does not waive the time limits.  Court will set for Preliminary Hearing on April 28, 2015 at 1:00 p.m.

Court adjourned at 1:36 p.m.
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.
Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.

1:11 p.m.  Defendant in custody and present in court without counsel.  Andrew Christenson for the State of Wisconsin.  Court finds probable cause.  DA makes bond recommendation.  Court sets bond at $5,000.00 cash and condition of:  Defendant is to maintain absolute sobriety - not to possess or consume any alcohol, illegal drugs or prescription drugs without a valid prescription.  Initial Appearance on April 20, 2015 at 1:30 p.m.

Court adjourned at 1:15 p.m.
